title:
On the set of stable primes for postcritically infinite maps over number
  fields
abstract:
Many interesting questions in arithmetic dynamics revolve, in one way or
another, around the (local and/or global) reducibility behavior of iterates of
a polynomial. We show that for very general families of integer polynomials $f$
(and, more generally, rational functions over number fields), the set of stable
primes, i.e., primes modulo which all iterates of $f$ are irreducible, is a
density zero set. Compared to previous results, our families cover a much wider
ground, and in particular apply to $100\%$ of polynomials of any given odd
degree, thus adding evidence to the conjecture that polynomials with a ``large"
set of stable primes are necessarily of a very specific shape, and in
particular are necessarily postcritically finite.
